title: Appropriateness of a Survey
question_text: In which of the following situations would it be inappropriate to gather data by way of a survey?

choices.text: A boutique hotel wants to know how satisfied guests are with the accommodations and services that are offered.
The publisher of textbooks wonders whether students would be able to remember more information if the text were printed in a variety of colors instead of simply with black type.
A researcher for a major movie chain wants to know the average number of times per month that teenagers go out to the movies.
A marketing researcher wants to know the proportion of women who usually skip breakfast at least twice a week.
All of these situations could effectively be investigated by using a survey.

solution:
A survey is a good way to gather data related to opinions and behaviors.

However, students would not accurately be able to report whether or not reading a text in a color other than black would enable them to remember more of the information that they have read. The best way to investigate this question would be by way of a well-designed and properly conducted experiment.

Explanation of Distractors

Choice 'A' is incorrect. It would be appropriate to gather data related to guest's opinions of the hotel by way of a survey.

Choice 'C' is incorrect. A survey could be used to measure teenagers behavior related to how often they go out to the movies.

Choice 'D' is incorrect. A survey would be an appropriate way to gather data that measures behavior with respect to eating breakfast.

Choice 'E' is incorrect since it would be inappropriate to use a survey for the purposes described in Choice 'B'.
